intro: Noronhia battiscombei, commonly known as the Batiscombé's noronhia, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, growing in shrubland or forest margins. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth habit.
